title: Fluffy Microwave Scrambled Eggs Recipe
description: Learn how to make scrambled eggs for breakfast that are soft, fluffy, and absolutely delicious with this quick and easy 3-ingredient microwave recipe.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe: Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Recipes Breakfast and Brunch Eggs Scrambled Fluffy Microwave Scrambled Eggs 4.8 (137) 127 Reviews 10 Photos These light and fluffy scrambled eggs are made in the microwave for a quick and easy breakfast to start your day. Follow the technique in this easy 3-ingredient recipe for perfect results every time. Submitted by Diana71 Updated on April 4, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 10 10 10 10 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 5 mins Total Time: 10 mins Servings: 2 Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe Looking for irresistibly fluffy scrambled eggs that are ready in mere minutes? Your microwave is the key! Don't believe us? Just try this top-rated recipe for microwave scrambled eggs. Can You Microwave Eggs? Of course! We wouldn't be here if you couldn't. This microwave method is hands-off (compared to the traditional stovetop method) and comes together in just a few minutes with three ingredients. What more could you ask for in a shortcut recipe? How to Cook Eggs In the Microwave There are plenty of ways to cook eggs in the microwave, but this method for scrambled eggs is perhaps our favorite. You'll find the full recipe below, but here's a brief overview of what you can expect: Crack the eggs into a microwave-safe bowl or mug, then mix well with milk and salt. Heat the eggs in the microwave for about 30 seconds, remove and beat well, then return to the microwave for another 30 seconds. Repeat until eggs are fully cooked and scrambled. 15 Meals You Should Be Making In Your Microwave How Long to Microwave Eggs Every microwave is different. The process could take anywhere from 1 minute to 2.5 minutes. Just be sure to microwave in 30-second intervals and to beat the eggs between every interval – this way, the eggs will scramble evenly and won't be overcooked. Microwave Egg Variations We think this three-ingredient recipe is perfect as it is. But, if you want to dress them up a bit, try one (or more) of these tasty mix-ins: CheeseStir in some shredded Cheddar or Monterey Jack for a cheesy twist. Ham or BaconDiced ham or chopped bacon makes this hearty recipe even more filling. VeggiesDiced bell peppers, onions, and spinach add color and flavor. To turn up the heat, try jalapeños. HerbsFresh herbs – such as basil, rosemary, oregano, and thyme – lend bright, earthy flavor. What to Serve With Scrambled Eggs For a classic breakfast, try pairing these microwave scrambled eggs with Basic Biscuits and Oven-Baked Bacon. You could also make a satisfying Scrambled Egg Sandwich or Breakfast Burrito. With this recipe, it's easy to keep it basic or get as creative as you want. The world is your oyster! Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise "I think this is an extremely handy technique for saving some dollars when you don't have a kitchen to cook in," says Christina De Jess Villanueva. "I made some scrambled eggs, toast and had a simple sandwich. Bonus points for adding toppings if you have them, I just didn't. Thanks for sharing!" "The constant stirring solves the rubbery eggs problem you normally get from microwaving," according to Tracy Gravel. "Our kitchen is torn apart and we were hungry for a hot breakfast this morning," says PAMimi. "Made these scrambled eggs and heated pre-cooked sausages at the same time. Had fresh fruit as a side. Excellent breakfast." Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 2 servings 4 large eggs ¼ cup milk ⅛ teaspoon salt Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Break the eggs into a microwave-proof mixing bowl. Add milk and salt; mix well. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Pop the bowl into the microwave and cook on high power for 30 seconds. Remove bowl, beat eggs very well, scraping down the sides of the bowl, and return to the microwave for another 30 seconds. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Repeat this pattern, stirring every 30 seconds for up to 2 ½ minutes. Stop when eggs have the consistency you desire. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve warm and enjoy! DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  I Made It Print 213 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Fluffy Microwave Scrambled Eggs 01 of 10 Photo by  DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  02 of 10 Photo by  Loretta Gray 02/12/2025 A keeper! Worth the effort Great flavors Recipe is great & so easy! I added 2 slices of thinly sliced ham & some shredded cheddar cheese, chopped in small pieces! Eggs stayed fluffy even with the addition of the ham & cheese! Eggs were better than cooking in a frying pan!! 03 of 10 Photo by  CopperBrew6628 09/10/2024 OK with tweaks Great recipe. 04 of 10 Photo by  EagerFeta6160 11/19/2023 absolutely delicious and perfect for university. i started off doing a minute at a time until it became fluffy 05 of 10 Photo by  LeeliTheBest 06/21/2023 Pretty good! This is perfect if you're in a situation where there's no real kitchen, and is a great recipe for college students. Due to the constant stirring, they didn't have a rubbery texture like most microwave eggs.These are delicious with some cheese and little bits of ham. Bacon would probably be just as good!However, they were not as good as I wanted them to be. While fluffy, they remained a bit soggy even when I put them in the microwave for longer. I would recommend adding slightly less milk than the amount in the recipe, or microwaving it longer.This was fun to try, but I think I'll stick to scrambling in a pan. 6/10 06 of 10 Photo by  Nikki Payton 12/10/2020 07 of 10 Photo by  T Few 12/01/2020 Very simple, easy instructions, looks delicious and tastes fantastic. ENJOY! 08 of 10 Photo by  shammie19 11/20/2020 09 of 10 Photo by  Dwayne Schuett 11/18/2020 10 of 10 Photo by  Diana71 03/14/2019 1 You’ll Also Love Green Chile Microwave Scrambled Eggs 1 Rating Microwave Scrambled Eggs 6 Ratings Microwave Longaniza con Huevos Scrambled Eggs in a Mug 70 Ratings Easy Fluffy Scrambled Eggs 65 Ratings Creamy Cottage Cheese Scrambled Eggs 184 Ratings Chorizo con Huevos (Spicy Mexican Sausage with Eggs) 38 Ratings Sriracha Scrambled Eggs 26 Ratings Zucchini with Egg 17 Ratings Best Scrambled Eggs 73 Ratings Black Bean Breakfast Bowl 134 Ratings Scrambled Eggs with Chorizo 32 Ratings Green Chile Tortilla Scramble 11 Ratings Ham and Cheese Chop Chop 19 Ratings Cottage Cheese Breakfast Bowl 3 Ratings Air Fryer Souffle Egg Cups 3 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. Remove bowl, beat eggs very well, scraping down the sides of the bowl, and return to the microwave for another 30 seconds. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Repeat this pattern, stirring every 30 seconds for up to 2 ½ minutes. Stop when eggs have the consistency you desire. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Serve warm and enjoy!
